etymology.description: 藕 (lotus root) + 粉 (powder) = lotus root starch/powder.
etymology.interpretation: Endocentric noun: 粉 marks the processed form of 藕. Refers to starch or powder extracted from lotus root, commonly used to make beverages, desserts, or as a thickener.

parts.english: lotus root; lotus rhizome; lotus tuber; edible rhizome

examples.chinese: 她用藕粉冲成一碗糊(她用藕粉沖成一碗糊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng ǒufěn chōng chéng yì wǎn hú.
examples.english: She brews lotus root starch into a bowl of porridge.

examples.chinese: 夏天喝冰藕粉很解暑(夏天喝冰藕粉很解暑)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān hē bīng ǒufěn hěn jiěshǔ.
examples.english: Drinking chilled lotus root starch in summer is very refreshing.

examples.chinese: 这家店卖的藕粉很细，很容易冲开(這家店賣的藕粉很細，很容易沖開)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā diàn mài de ǒufěn hěn xì, hěn róngyì chōng kāi.
examples.english: The lotus root starch sold at this shop is very fine and dissolves easily.
